description: CryptoMate's low code SaaS infrastructure allows any company to easily deploy smart fintech offerings that evolves with their clients needs.
problem_statement:
We focus on the 93 Million SMEs in LATAM that define as main challenges: 
Providing credit facilities for their customers.
Optimizing their payments (Sales and Suppliers), locally and internationally.
Currency volatility, inflation, capital restrictions.

We believe lowering the barriers of entry to financial tools is the only way to truely excel in ESG 8, 9 and 11.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: We focus on the 93 Million SMEs in LATAM that define as main challenges: 
Providing credit facilities for their customers.
Optimizing their payments (Sales and Suppliers), locally and internationally.
Currency volatility, inflation, capital restrictions.
Market size: 93M SMEs in LATAM and then expanding around other emerging markets to cover Stablecoin Market 30 Trillion USD by 2030 (10x growth from current value) and Private credit market 4 Trillion USD by 2030 (2x growth from current value)

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: utila.io
squarefi.co
magic.link
Fireblocks.io

Unique selling proposition:
CryptoMate is a Low Code Fireblocks + Stripe + Agents, laser focused in LATAM:

Prompt your way into innovation: Launch neobanks, credit card programs, BNPL and collateralized lending programs in minutes.
Omnichannel: Available via MCP (Claude, Cursor, Windsurf, others),  APIs, and our web platform.
Bitcoin Sandwich: Use bitcoin to hedge your inflows, expenditures and multi currency flows.
Multi rails: Deliver programmable, payment and credit solutions on VISA, Mastercard and Paypal Networks.
In-market since: Yes, since 3 years

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: +30 customers in +12 countries (Exchanges, payment wallets, FX business, Other Fintech and Retail).
+3M USD transactional value per month.
+10k Credit card issued and growing at +2500 cards per month organically
+2M USD Total locked value.
+3.500 new blockchain addresses assigned per month.
+20k USD MRR on subscription business + 15k USD on monthly transactional fees (10k on cards fees, and 5k on On/Of ramping fees).
Customers: +30 b2b customers,
Sales pipeline:
Lead generation: email marketing, Linkeding, direct approach to target market. 
Early subscription: Trials and early integrations
Upsale to Build subscription: Client's Product launch.
UpSale to Growth subscription: Client's Transactional revenue surpasses subsription fees.

Lead generation to Early subscription takes around 1 month.
Early subscription to Growth takes around 3 months.
Pricing: All of them are paying.
Pricing structure:
Start subscription: 250 USD/Month
Build subscription: 750 USD/Month
Growth Subscription: 1500 USD/Month

ecosystem_signals.justification:
Program source: techcrunch news
Referral: nan

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: Alan Boryszanski, CEO, https://www.linkedin.com/in/alanboryszanski/
Guido De Luca, CTO, https://www.linkedin.com/in/guido-de-luca-791403224/
Tech team: Everyhting is developed in house, and every developer signs an invention Assigment agreement against our holidng company in USA

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: Shifting regulatory frameworks. Brand awareness. Optimizing pipeline of success cases and replication
Networking with local US banks, BIN sponsors, and re-sellers

founder_profile.name: [Alan Boryszanski](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alanboryszanski/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment: When developing one of the biggest challenger crypto banks in LATAM and setting up the infrastructure for it to operate with local banks and liquidity providers. I realized that when expanding to a second country i had to do everything all over again. We were spending 100x more time on operational setups than product market fit. That was the moment i knew there has to be a better way, we are not supposed to push the same solution everywhere bliendly and by brut force, we should be here to empower our clients to achieve their visions, making them more efficient, international, and adaptative to their users needs. That's when CryptoMate was born.

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

gtm_support_potential.justification: Corporate partnerships and potential PoC development. Expanding our sales strategies. Co-creating and exploreing potential synergies with other startups and alumni. Introduction to potential growth partners/investors

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Potential partnerships with other SV-backed platforms and vendors targeting the same buyer.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Shifting regulatory frameworks. Brand awareness. Optimizing pipeline of success cases and replication
Networking with local US banks, BIN sponsors, and re-sellers

category_comparison: CryptoMate positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.

primary_competitors.name: Incumbent Providers
primary_competitors.description: Traditional solutions or services that lack personalization, automation, or modern UX.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company differentiates via digital-first, user-centric, or AI-driven design. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

primary_competitors.name: Point Solutions
primary_competitors.description: Niche vendors addressing one aspect of the problem.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company offers a more integrated or holistic experience. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: CryptoMate is positioned well in its category with a differentiated product. With further traction and partnerships, it could emerge as a category leader.

final_recommendation.rationale: Pending deeper review, financial validation, and external signal confirmation.
